intro: Tristagma sessile, commonly known as the sessile tristagma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in summer. Tristagma sessile is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
